# Arpeggio: Major 7th in G (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is the sounding of the notes of a chord in rapid succession rather than simultaneously. The Major 7th arpeggio in G with a D shape refers to the arpeggio of G major 7th chord using the D major chord shape as a reference point.

## Notes and Intervals:
- G (Root)
- B (Major 3rd)
- D (Perfect 5th)
- F# (Major 7th)

## Musical Flavor:
The Major 7th arpeggio in G using the D shape produces a sweet and jazzy sound. The Major 7th interval gives it a lush and sophisticated quality, often adding a touch of tension and color to the overall harmonic structure. This arpeggio sounds expressive and can evoke emotion and elegance in music.

## Genre and Usage:
The Major 7th arpeggio in G is commonly used in jazz, bossa nova, and other sophisticated styles of music. It can be heard in various jazz standards, ballads, and smooth jazz compositions. This arpeggio is also prevalent in fusion and contemporary jazz genres.

## Songs:
1. *"Girl From Ipanema"* by Antonio Carlos Jobim - This famous bossa nova tune features the Major 7th arpeggio in G in various sections, adding a melodic and harmonic richness to the song.
  
2. *"So What"* by Miles Davis - In this iconic jazz piece, the Major 7th arpeggio in G is subtly hinted at in the harmonic progression, contributing to the cool and modal vibe of the composition.

3. *"Spain"* by Chick Corea - This jazz fusion classic prominently showcases the Major 7th arpeggio in G, highlighting its versatility and ability to create intricate melodies and harmonies within a complex musical arrangement.
